title: 222 - April First
description:
Cause and effect. When you do something it has an effect on something else. The other side is when you don’t do something it still affects something. Last week CJ talked about the difficulties of not having the same routine that he’s had over the last few years. Because he hasn’t had the same routine it was affecting how he went about his day. Today he starts the conversation with somewhat of an epiphany and how although he’s not able to have his normal routine, he still has an opportunity to fix his gaps and increase his strengths. ET rounds out the conversation on what you can do to regain your confidence and how to take advantage of this time instead of letting it pass by.
 The Secret to Success Topics:
  [03:13] - Fair or Foul
 [12:00] - Rona News
 [19:00] - Cause & Effect
 [35:00] - Be Careful
 [50:48] - Survive
 [1:13:00] - When You Feel Weak
 [1:25:00] - APOC
  Listener Perks:
  The Prescription Album
 Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go.
 Text ET at 313-251-1181 and follow us on IG @S2SPodcast
  Secrets 2 Success:
  You now have time to enhance the things you're good at and fix the areas in which you are weak.
 Stop practicing like you have home court advantage. You don’t
 The way you train determines how you’re going to play the game.
 The pre-season is more valuable than the season itself.
 You’re most vulnerable in transition.
  Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via  Apple Podcasts.

Cause and effect. When you do something it has an effect on something else. The other side is when you don’t do something it still affects something. Last week CJ talked about the difficulties of not having the same routine that he’s had over the last few years. Because he hasn’t had the same routine it was affecting how he went about his day. Today he starts the conversation with somewhat of an epiphany and how although he’s not able to have his normal routine, he still has an opportunity to fix his gaps and increase his strengths. ET rounds out the conversation on what you can do to regain your confidence and how to take advantage of this time instead of letting it pass by.
